flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=960>>960.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=268>>268 games.
50/100 of these games means 50/100 * 268 games = <<50/100*268=134>>134 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 134 games * $7/game = $<<134*7=938>>938 on them.
The other 134 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him 134 games * $3/game = $<<134*3=402>>402.
On all games in total Daniel spent $960 + $938 + $402 = $<<960+938+402=2300>>2300.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 266, not 268. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
